text: my dad published a a a a a kind of uh
literature a kind of History
um that was about African-Americans but
was mostly created by lay
African-American historians it was a
kind of
counternarrative
um the social sciences uh uh for many is
especially posts slavery
uh were basically deployed as a weapon
against
African-Americans um and so a lot of
African-Americans who went into the
social sciences were motivated
particularly uh by this urge to create a
counter narrative something to fight
back with my dad published a lot of that
stuff but mostly by people who went into
lay history um his point was to create a
tradition to show that we we had a
tradition of recording our own history
and what that tradition looked like
um African-Americans unlike other
Americans don't have uh the sort of
lineage thing uh we can't trace our
people back to a certain uh uh uh
portion of Italy we can't you know Trace
our folks back to a certain uh County in
in Ireland we we we don't have that we
begin here we are in many ways um maybe
uh short of Native Americans the only
real real true Native Americans
um because we really do begin here I
mean those of us who live in cities
migrated up from the south so our
motherland is very much Mississippi
North Carolina
Alabama I say that to say I would read
those books and they would fill in for
me who I was I need a better way of
saying it but I don't have one it was it
was like religion for me um it created a
lineage and then it also created an
explanation for why things were the way
they were why we were here it gave
me not an objective understanding okay
um but it gave
me purpose
almost religion is the best way to
explain it it said you know you're here
because you're an African-American and
there's a particular you're a black
person and more importantly you're an
African that's probably the way I would
have put it at that at that point in
time and the great cause the Great War
of this era is one over race it's people
who don't look like you trying to
enslave you trying to exploit you and
that's why you're in this situation
right now now we could quibble with that
explanation and I later complicated it
but for a 13-year-old kid trying to walk
up and down the street in West Baltimore
it was it was it was a it was a good
thing it was a good thing it made it
okay for me at that particular point in
time and just going back to the
imagination thing it filled my head and
it it made me work with my own
imagination uh to create some sort of
narrative of of who I
was I don't have a good answer for that
because you know I they're probably is
but I'm not a part of it
um a good friend of mine very very very
good friend of mine um who I had not
seen in a while had lunch with just
before my Memoir was coming out and he
said you know he was quoting another
writer so the writer told him you there
three things for writers in this life
you can have a great career you can have
a great love
life and you can have great friends you
don't get all three you get to pick two
okay
um I picked the love life and I picked
my
career um and and writing is the sort of
thing that you can't you can't really
get better as as a buddy of mine was say
you can't get better in a crowd it's a
solitary thing it's you and the paper
it's you and and the screen and the
keyboard and and that's it it's not a
team game regrettably um it also absorbs
a crazy amount of time I mean it really
absorbs an insane so if you have any
sort of family like like I do um it's
very hard to maintain a bigger Community
now there's a a community of folks uh
out in the blogging World a very
multi-racial Community um but that's
because the internet makes it easier to
stay in touch but I think not like in
the past at least not for me now there
may be a community out there um I'm I'm
cut off with from it
because I only want to be in so many
conversations with other writers about
writing um what I want to be is out on
the street uh with other people having
conversations about living um I don't
want to talk to too many other people
who write for a living um I'm trying to
create something original and something
different hopefully that's my goal I
don't know if I'll get there but that
that is my goal
um I'm not interested in having too many
conversations about writing um I want to
know what's going on out in the world
and try to reflect that
